title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0236

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Catherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine。

segments.en: And today we're talking a little bit about going to sleep or not being able to sleep.
segments.cn: 今天我们要谈谈睡觉或失眠的问题。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: We are having some sleeping problems.
segments.cn: 我们有一些睡眠问题。

segments.en: And we're actually going to check out a couple of words related to this topic right now on Vocabulary Preview.
segments.cn: 现在我们要在词汇预览中查看几个与此主题相关的单词。

segments.en: Vocabulary Preview Okay, so the first word is actually the technical word that describes being unable to sleep.
segments.cn: 词汇预览 第一个单词是描述失眠的专业术语。

segments.en: It's called insomnia.
segments.cn: 叫做失眠。

segments.en: Right, so if you have insomnia, it means that you can't fall asleep, you can't sleep.
segments.cn: 对，如果你失眠，意味着你无法入睡，无法睡觉。

segments.en: Okay, so this is a pretty serious condition.
segments.cn: 这是一种相当严重的状况。

segments.en: For example, if you have insomnia and you don't sleep for three or four nights, you're not going to do very well at work, right?
segments.cn: 例如，如果你失眠，三四天不睡觉，你在工作上表现不会很好，对吧？

segments.en: Right, or if you're studying, you're tired at school, you can't concentrate, so it's a very big problem.
segments.cn: 对，或者如果你在学习，学校里很累，无法集中注意力，这就是一个很大的问题。

segments.en: What's that other word, though?
segments.cn: 还有另一个词是什么呢？

segments.en: We have insomnia, but we also have another interesting disorder.
segments.cn: 我们有失眠，但还有另一种有趣的障碍。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: If somebody is able to sleep, but walks while they're sleeping, that person is called a sleepwalker.
segments.cn: 如果有人能睡觉，但在睡觉时走动，那个人叫做梦游者。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And you don't actually just have to walk to be a sleepwalker.
segments.cn: 而且你不一定要走动才能成为梦游者。

segments.en: You can do any number of strange things, like basically acting like you're awake when you're not.
segments.cn: 你可以做很多奇怪的事情，比如在不清醒的时候表现得像是清醒的。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So some people get up and walk, actually go outside.
segments.cn: 有些人会起床走动，甚至走到外面。

segments.en: Some people get dressed, some people even go downstairs and cook.
segments.cn: 有些人会穿衣服，有些人甚至会下楼做饭。

segments.en: Yeah, that's right.
segments.cn: 是的，没错。

segments.en: And the worst is the people who eat because they gain weight and they don't know why.
segments.cn: 最糟糕的是那些吃东西的人，因为他们增重却不知道为什么。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So sleepwalking is what you do, and if you do this, you're called a sleepwalker.
segments.cn: 所以梦游就是你所做的，如果你这样做，你就叫做梦游者。

segments.en: Okay, sleepwalk is the verb, sleepwalker is the noun or the person.
segments.cn: 好的，梦游是动词，梦游者是名词或人。

segments.en: All right, so we've taken a look at two words that we're going to find in our dialogue today.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们已经看了两个今天对话中会出现的单词。

segments.en: Why don't we go now and listen to the dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 现在我们来听第一次对话吧。

segments.en: Alex, what's up with you?
segments.cn: Alex，你怎么了？

segments.en: You look dreadful.
segments.cn: 你看起来很糟糕。

segments.en: Hey, Jill.
segments.cn: 嘿，Jill。

segments.en: I don't know.
segments.cn: 我不知道。

segments.en: I've been having trouble sleeping these past few weeks.
segments.cn: 这几周我一直在失眠。

segments.en: I usually lie in bed for hours trying to get to sleep.
segments.cn: 我通常躺在床上几个小时试图入睡。

segments.en: I've tried stretching and different breathing techniques before going to bed.
segments.cn: 我尝试过在睡觉前拉伸和不同的呼吸技巧。

segments.en: I've tried eating and not eating different foods.
segments.cn: 我尝试过吃和不吃不同的食物。

segments.en: I've even tried counting sheep.
segments.cn: 我甚至尝试过数羊。

segments.en: And then, when I finally get to sleep, I have these really disturbing nightmares.
segments.cn: 然后，当我终于入睡时，我会做一些非常可怕的噩梦。

segments.en: So I usually wake up in a panic and more tired than before I went to sleep.
segments.cn: 所以我通常会惊慌地醒来，比入睡前更累。

segments.en: Wow.
segments.cn: 哇。

segments.en: Maybe you should get that checked out.
segments.cn: 也许你应该去检查一下。

segments.en: Maybe you're stressed?
segments.cn: 也许你有压力？

segments.en: Just take some sedatives.
segments.cn: 只需吃一些镇静剂。

segments.en: Works for me.
segments.cn: 对我有效。

segments.en: Every so often, having some Melatonin on hand helps me when I have trouble sleeping.
segments.cn: 每隔一段时间，手头有一些褪黑激素在我失眠时会有帮助。

segments.en: It works on all kinds of sleeping disorders.
segments.cn: 它对各种睡眠障碍有效。

segments.en: It's the stuff pilots use to regulate their sleeping patterns.
segments.cn: 这是飞行员用来调节睡眠模式的东西。

segments.en: I heard of that.
segments.cn: 我听说过这个。

segments.en: But does that apply to Alex's situation?
segments.cn: 但这适用于Alex的情况吗？

segments.en: Yeah, sure.
segments.cn: 是的，当然。

segments.en: Why not?
segments.cn: 为什么不呢？

segments.en: Sounds like he only has transient insomnia, since it's a recent thing, so taking Melatonin should do the trick.
segments.cn: 听起来他只是暂时性失眠，因为这是最近的事情，所以服用褪黑激素应该有效。

segments.en: But shouldn't he be looking into why it's been happening?
segments.cn: 但他不应该调查一下为什么会这样吗？

segments.en: Well, aren't you the little psychologist?
segments.cn: 嗯，你真是个小心理学家。

segments.en: Our buddy's having trouble sleeping.
segments.cn: 我们的朋友正在失眠。

segments.en: It's easy and curable.
segments.cn: 这很简单且可治愈。

segments.en: It's not something freakish, like if he was a sleepwalker.
segments.cn: 这不是一些奇怪的事情，比如他是梦游者。

segments.en: Well, there's that, too.
segments.cn: 嗯，这也是。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So obviously, this person not only has insomnia, but also has nightmares, sleep walks, a mess.
segments.cn: 所以显然，这个人不仅失眠，还有噩梦，梦游，真是一团糟。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And you can tell when someone hasn't been sleeping well.
segments.cn: 你可以看出一个人睡得不好。

segments.en: They have that look, like there's bags under their eyes, or they just look really tired.
segments.cn: 他们有那种神情，眼睛下有黑眼圈，或者看起来真的很累。

segments.en: And so, the friend here says, Alex, you look dreadful.
segments.cn: 所以，这位朋友说，Alex，你看起来很糟糕。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Dreadful.
segments.cn: 糟糕。

segments.en: So this is an adjective, and it's a way to describe someone that looks terrible.
segments.cn: 这是一个形容词，用来描述看起来很糟糕的人。

segments.en: You look horrible.
segments.cn: 你看起来很可怕。

segments.en: You look tired.
segments.cn: 你看起来很累。

segments.en: You look sleepy.
segments.cn: 你看起来很困。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So this is not a compliment.
segments.cn: 这不是一个赞美。

segments.en: This is something that you say when you're worried about someone.
segments.cn: 这是你在担心某人时说的。

segments.en: So, for example, if someone's really, really tired, you say, you look dreadful.
segments.cn: 例如，如果某人真的很累，你会说，你看起来很糟糕。

segments.en: Or if someone is wearing very dirty clothes, they don't look like they went home yesterday, you say, what's wrong?
segments.cn: 或者如果某人穿着非常脏的衣服，看起来像是昨天没回家，你会说，怎么了？

segments.en: You look dreadful.
segments.cn: 你看起来很糟糕。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: I think you can also use it to describe objects or maybe food, right?
segments.cn: 我想你也可以用它来描述物体或食物，对吧？

segments.en: This lasagna is dreadful.
segments.cn: 这份千层面真糟糕。

segments.en: It means it's very bad.
segments.cn: 意思是它非常糟糕。

segments.en: And you don't want to say that to the person who cooked it, of course.
segments.cn: 当然你不想对做这道菜的人说这个。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So the person, obviously, because is suffering from insomnia, looks dreadful.
segments.cn: 所以这个人显然因为失眠而看起来很糟糕。

segments.en: And he was explaining what he does to try to fall asleep.
segments.cn: 他在解释他尝试入睡的方法。

segments.en: For example, counting sheep, stretching.
segments.cn: 例如，数羊，拉伸。

segments.en: And he also said that he tried different breathing techniques.
segments.cn: 他还说他尝试过不同的呼吸技巧。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So basically a technique is an approach to something, a kind of method.
segments.cn: 所以基本上，技巧是一种方法，一种方法。

segments.en: But in this case, we're talking about breathing techniques.
segments.cn: 但在这种情况下，我们谈论的是呼吸技巧。

segments.en: So for some people, one breathing technique is breathing in through your nose and breathing out through your mouth.
segments.cn: 对于某些人来说，一种呼吸技巧是通过鼻子吸气，通过嘴巴呼气。

segments.en: Like that.
segments.cn: 就像这样。

segments.en: That's one kind of technique.
segments.cn: 这是一种技巧。

segments.en: So a technique, as you say, is a way of doing something.
segments.cn: 所以技巧，正如你所说，是做某事的方法。

segments.en: So breathing techniques are different ways of breathing.
segments.cn: 所以呼吸技巧是不同的呼吸方式。

segments.en: So maybe you will relax, so maybe you'll fall asleep, things like this.
segments.cn: 也许你会放松，也许你会入睡，类似的事情。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: It's one of those things that you might learn about in a yoga class, for example.
segments.cn: 这是一种你可能在瑜伽课上学到的东西，例如。

segments.en: There's different breathing techniques.
segments.cn: 有不同的呼吸技巧。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: And you can combine techniques with other words as well, adding the I-N-G.
segments.cn: 你也可以将技巧与其他词结合，添加 I-N-G。

segments.en: For example, you have walking techniques maybe to put less stress on your knees.
segments.cn: 例如，你可能有走路技巧，以减少对膝盖的压力。

segments.en: Or running techniques, swimming techniques.
segments.cn: 或跑步技巧，游泳技巧。

segments.en: I think there's a technique for almost everything.
segments.cn: 我认为几乎每件事都有技巧。

segments.en: Just about anything you can do, there's a technique for it.
segments.cn: 你能做的任何事情，都有相应的技巧。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Yeah, for sure.
segments.cn: 是的，当然。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: And well, moving on, he was talking about his nightmares.
segments.cn: 那么，继续，他在谈论他的噩梦。

segments.en: And he described his nightmares as disturbing.
segments.cn: 他形容他的噩梦是令人不安的。

segments.en: He has disturbing nightmares.
segments.cn: 他有令人不安的噩梦。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Well, I think this is an important word to cover here, Marco, because we've heard the verb to disturb before.
segments.cn: 我认为这是一个重要的词，Marco，因为我们之前听过动词“打扰”。

segments.en: Like, I'm sorry to disturb you.
segments.cn: 比如，我很抱歉打扰你。

segments.en: Means I'm sorry to bother you.
segments.cn: 意思是我很抱歉打扰你。

segments.en: But disturbing is an adjective.
segments.cn: 但“令人不安”是一个形容词。

segments.en: It describes something that makes me very uncomfortable.
segments.cn: 它描述的是让我感到非常不舒服的事物。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So, for example, a lot of times in the news, we see very disturbing images, car accidents or fires or bombs.
segments.cn: 例如，很多时候在新闻中，我们看到非常令人不安的图像，车祸、火灾或炸弹。

segments.en: And what's disturbing is when you see human beings who have been hurt.
segments.cn: 令人不安的是，当你看到受伤的人类。

segments.en: So, images that make you really uncomfortable or sad, these are disturbing.
segments.cn: 所以，让你感到非常不舒服或悲伤的图像，这些都是令人不安的。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So, disturbing nightmares are nightmares that are not very pleasant.
segments.cn: 所以，令人不安的噩梦是那些不太愉快的噩梦。

segments.en: They make him scared maybe or uncomfortable.
segments.cn: 它们可能让他感到害怕或不舒服。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Like a dream, for example, where your parents die.
segments.cn: 比如，一个梦，父母去世。

segments.en: It's pretty disturbing.
segments.cn: 这非常令人不安。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: And well, one of his friends recommended, you know what?
segments.cn: 他的一个朋友建议，你知道吗？

segments.en: Stop with all of this.
segments.cn: 停止这一切。

segments.en: Just take some sedatives.
segments.cn: 只需服用一些镇静剂。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So, sedatives are a kind of medicine that help a person relax or that help make a person tired.
segments.cn: 所以，镇静剂是一种帮助人放松或让人感到疲倦的药物。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So, I think it comes from the verb to sedate.
segments.cn: 所以，我认为它来自动词“镇静”。

segments.en: Yes.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: And basically, that is to calm down, to tranquilize.
segments.cn: 基本上，就是让人冷静下来，镇静。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So, in this case, we're talking about a person, but you can also give an animal sedatives.
segments.cn: 所以，在这种情况下，我们谈论的是一个人，但你也可以给动物使用镇静剂。

segments.en: For example, if you want to take your dog on an airplane, the dog needs to relax.
segments.cn: 例如，如果你想带你的狗上飞机，狗需要放松。

segments.en: You give it some sedatives.
segments.cn: 你给它一些镇静剂。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: And I think when he mentioned a specific name of a sedative, it's Melatonin.
segments.cn: 我认为当他提到某种特定的镇静剂时，是褪黑激素。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So, Melatonin is a chemical that our bodies naturally produce that help calm us down.
segments.cn: 所以，褪黑激素是我们身体自然产生的一种化学物质，帮助我们冷静下来。

segments.en: And so, a lot of pharmaceutical companies or drug companies sell Melatonin in a pill form.
segments.cn: 因此，许多制药公司或药品公司以药丸形式出售褪黑激素。

segments.en: It's basically, it's a chemical that helps you relax.
segments.cn: 基本上，它是一种帮助你放松的化学物质。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So, obviously, if you take Melatonin, you're going to feel sleepy or you're going to be very relaxed and you're going to fall asleep a lot easier.
segments.cn: 所以，显然，如果你服用褪黑激素，你会感到困倦，或者你会非常放松，入睡会容易得多。

segments.en: Well, hopefully.
segments.cn: 好吧，希望如此。

segments.en: Hopefully.
segments.cn: 希望如此。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So, and well, the whole thing that we've been talking about, insomnia, sleepwalking, these are called sleeping disorders.
segments.cn: 所以，关于我们一直在谈论的失眠、梦游，这些被称为睡眠障碍。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Or you might also hear the term sleep disorders.
segments.cn: 或者你也可能听到“睡眠障碍”这个术语。

segments.en: They mean problems with sleeping.
segments.cn: 它们意味着睡眠问题。

segments.en: So, people who either cannot fall asleep or people who have bad dreams or people who sleepwalk.
segments.cn: 所以，无法入睡的人，或者做噩梦的人，或者梦游的人。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So, a disorder is something of an illness or a condition that is not normal.
segments.cn: 所以，障碍是指一种疾病或不正常的状态。

segments.en: So, for example, as you said, a sleeping disorder or a sleep disorder, it means that you're not able to sleep properly or normally.
segments.cn: 例如，正如你所说，睡眠障碍或睡眠问题，意味着你无法正常入睡。

segments.en: But there are other kinds of disorders, right?
segments.cn: 但还有其他类型的障碍，对吧？

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: I guess many people have heard of eating disorders.
segments.cn: 我想很多人听说过饮食障碍。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So, that's basically people who do not eat like everyone else.
segments.cn: 所以，这基本上是指那些饮食方式与其他人不同的人。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So, that's what happens with a disorder.
segments.cn: 所以，这就是障碍的表现。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So, we've taken a look at a lot of vocab.
segments.cn: 所以，我们已经看了很多词汇。

segments.en: Now, it's time for us to take a look at Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在，是时候看看流利度提升了。

segments.en: But before that, why don't we listen to the dialogue again?
segments.cn: 但在此之前，为什么不再听一次对话呢？

segments.en: Alex, what's up with you?
segments.cn: Alex，你怎么了？

segments.en: You look dreadful.
segments.cn: 你看起来很糟糕。

segments.en: Hey, Jill.
segments.cn: 嘿，Jill。

segments.en: I don't know.
segments.cn: 我不知道。

segments.en: I've been having trouble sleeping these past few weeks.
segments.cn: 这几周我一直在睡觉方面有问题。

segments.en: I usually lie in bed for hours trying to get to sleep.
segments.cn: 我通常躺在床上几个小时试图入睡。

segments.en: I've tried stretching and different breathing techniques before going to bed.
segments.cn: 我尝试过在睡觉前拉伸和不同的呼吸技巧。

segments.en: I've tried eating and not eating different foods.
segments.cn: 我尝试过吃和不吃不同的食物。

segments.en: I've even tried counting sheep.
segments.cn: 我甚至尝试过数羊。

segments.en: And then, when I finally get to sleep, I have these really disturbing nightmares.
segments.cn: 然后，当我终于入睡时，我会做一些非常令人不安的噩梦。

segments.en: So, I usually wake up in a panic and more tired than before I went to sleep.
segments.cn: 所以，我通常会惊慌地醒来，比入睡前更累。

segments.en: Wow.
segments.cn: 哇。

segments.en: Maybe you should get that checked out.
segments.cn: 也许你应该去检查一下。

segments.en: Maybe you're stressed?
segments.cn: 也许你很紧张？

segments.en: Just take some sedatives.
segments.cn: 只需服用一些镇静剂。

segments.en: Works for me.
segments.cn: 对我来说有效。

segments.en: Every so often, having some Melatonin on hand helps me when I have trouble sleeping.
segments.cn: 每隔一段时间，手头有一些褪黑激素可以帮助我入睡。

segments.en: It works on all kinds of sleeping disorders.
segments.cn: 它对各种睡眠障碍有效。

segments.en: It's the stuff pilots use to regulate their sleeping patterns.
segments.cn: 这是飞行员用来调节睡眠模式的东西。

segments.en: I heard of that.
segments.cn: 我听说过这个。

segments.en: But does that apply to Alex's situation?
segments.cn: 但这适用于Alex的情况吗？

segments.en: Yeah, sure.
segments.cn: 是的，当然。

segments.en: Why not?
segments.cn: 为什么不呢？

segments.en: Sounds like he only has transient insomnia since it's a recent thing.
segments.cn: 听起来他只是暂时性失眠，因为这是最近发生的事。

segments.en: So, taking Melatonin should do the trick.
segments.cn: 所以，服用褪黑激素应该有效。

segments.en: But shouldn't he be looking into why it's been happening?
segments.cn: 但他不应该调查一下为什么会这样吗？

segments.en: Well, aren't you the little psychologist?
segments.cn: 哦，你真是个小心理学家。

segments.en: Our buddy's having trouble sleeping.
segments.cn: 我们的朋友正在经历失眠。

segments.en: It's easy and curable.
segments.cn: 这很简单且可治愈。

segments.en: It's not something freakish like if he was a sleepwalker.
segments.cn: 这不是像梦游那样的怪事。

segments.en: Well, there's that too.
segments.cn: 嗯，这也是。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So, now we have three main phrases for Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在我们有三个主要短语用于流利表达。

segments.en: Why don't we start with the first one?
segments.cn: 我们为什么不从第一个开始呢？

segments.en: Okay, so you heard in today's dialogue an interesting phrase.
segments.cn: 好的，你在今天的对话中听到了一个有趣的短语。

segments.en: I don't know if it exists in other languages.
segments.cn: 我不知道它在其他语言中是否存在。

segments.en: But in English, we say when you're trying to fall asleep, there's a good technique to help you do so.
segments.cn: 但在英语中，我们说当你试图入睡时，有一个好技巧可以帮助你。

segments.en: You count sheep.
segments.cn: 你数羊。

segments.en: Yeah, I think you see it in cartoons all the time.
segments.cn: 是的，我想你在卡通中经常看到。

segments.en: A person is sleeping and over that cartoon's head is a little cloud.
segments.cn: 一个人在睡觉，卡通头上有一个小云朵。

segments.en: And you see sheep jumping over a fence, right?
segments.cn: 你看到羊跳过栅栏，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, basically there's a fence and you say one, two, three.
segments.cn: 是的，基本上有一个栅栏，你说一、二、三。

segments.en: And the process of counting helps relax a person.
segments.cn: 计数的过程有助于放松一个人。

segments.en: And you fall asleep.
segments.cn: 然后你就入睡了。

segments.en: So, counting sheep, I guess you're not literally out in a field counting sheep.
segments.cn: 所以，数羊，我想你并不是字面上在田野里数羊。

segments.en: You're just imagining sheep in your head and you're trying to fall asleep.
segments.cn: 你只是想象脑海中的羊，试图入睡。

segments.en: That's right, counting sheep.
segments.cn: 没错，数羊。

segments.en: Alright.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: Well, one of his friends recommended that maybe he should go to a doctor.
segments.cn: 嗯，他的一个朋友建议他也许应该去看医生。

segments.en: And Jill said that by saying, maybe you should get that checked out.
segments.cn: 而吉尔说，或许你应该去检查一下。

segments.en: Okay, so to get something checked out.
segments.cn: 好的，所以去检查一下。

segments.en: To get it checked out.
segments.cn: 去检查一下。

segments.en: This means to have a professional give you a suggestion or to have a professional look at something.
segments.cn: 这意味着让专业人士给你建议或让专业人士查看某事。

segments.en: Exactly, so maybe you should get examined.
segments.cn: 正是如此，所以也许你应该去检查一下。

segments.en: Maybe you should go to the doctor.
segments.cn: 也许你应该去看医生。

segments.en: This isn't just about disorders, right?
segments.cn: 这不仅仅是关于障碍，对吧？

segments.en: I mean, what if I have a sore tooth?
segments.cn: 我的意思是，如果我有牙痛呢？

segments.en: I could say this.
segments.cn: 我可以这样说。

segments.en: Right, so if you have a toothache, I would recommend, maybe you should get that checked out by my dentist.
segments.cn: 对，所以如果你有牙痛，我会建议你去我的牙医那里检查一下。

segments.en: Right, or maybe if you have a bad rash, you know, your skin is very red.
segments.cn: 对，或者如果你有严重的皮疹，你知道，你的皮肤非常红。

segments.en: I say, Marco, I think you should get that checked out by a doctor.
segments.cn: 我会说，马尔科，我认为你应该去看医生。

segments.en: Exactly, so to get something checked, to get something examined by a doctor or a professional.
segments.cn: 正是如此，去检查一下，去让医生或专业人士检查某事。

segments.en: Alright, and the last phrase that we have for you.
segments.cn: 好吧，最后一个短语。

segments.en: So the last phrase we have today comes from a suggestion at the end.
segments.cn: 所以我们今天的最后一个短语来自于最后的建议。

segments.en: The friend suggests taking Melatonin.
segments.cn: 朋友建议服用褪黑激素。

segments.en: And he says, listen, taking Melatonin should do the trick.
segments.cn: 他说，听着，服用褪黑激素应该有效。

segments.en: Right, so if you end the phrase by saying, that should do the trick.
segments.cn: 对，所以如果你结束短语时说，应该有效。

segments.en: Basically, you're saying that should solve your problem.
segments.cn: 基本上，你是在说这应该解决你的问题。

segments.en: That should help you.
segments.cn: 这应该帮助你。

segments.en: Exactly, so the trick, you don't have to think about what the trick is.
segments.cn: 正是如此，所以这个技巧，你不必考虑这个技巧是什么。

segments.en: It's just a way of saying it should fix your problem.
segments.cn: 这只是说它应该解决你的问题。

segments.en: So for example, when someone is fixing my car and they have one more thing to do and it's finished.
segments.cn: 例如，当有人在修我的车，他们还有一件事要做，完成了。

segments.en: He says, the car mechanic might say, that should do the trick.
segments.cn: 他说，汽车修理工可能会说，应该有效。

segments.en: That means problem solved.
segments.cn: 这意味着问题解决了。

segments.en: Or maybe you want to hang a picture on your wall.
segments.cn: 或者也许你想在墙上挂一幅画。

segments.en: So somebody puts a nail in the wall and that should do the trick and maybe that will hold up the painting.
segments.cn: 所以有人在墙上钉了一个钉子，这应该有效，也许这能支撑住画。

segments.en: Done.
segments.cn: 完成。

segments.en: So that's a way of saying, that should solve the problem, this should be the solution, that should be all.
segments.cn: 所以这是一种说法，应该解决问题，这应该是解决方案，这应该就够了。

segments.en: Okay, so why don't we go back and listen to the dialogue one last time.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们为什么不回去再听一次对话。

segments.en: Alex, what's up with you?
segments.cn: 亚历克斯，你怎么了？

segments.en: You look dreadful.
segments.cn: 你看起来很糟糕。

segments.en: Hey Jill, I don't know.
segments.cn: 嘿，吉尔，我不知道。

segments.en: I've been having trouble sleeping these past few weeks.
segments.cn: 这几周我一直在失眠。

segments.en: I usually lie in bed for hours trying to get to sleep.
segments.cn: 我通常躺在床上几个小时试图入睡。

segments.en: I've tried stretching and different breathing techniques before going to bed.
segments.cn: 我尝试过在睡觉前拉伸和不同的呼吸技巧。

segments.en: I've tried eating and not eating different foods.
segments.cn: 我尝试过吃和不吃不同的食物。

segments.en: I've even tried counting sheep.
segments.cn: 我甚至尝试过数羊。

segments.en: And then when I finally get to sleep, I have these really disturbing nightmares.
segments.cn: 然后当我终于入睡时，我会做一些非常可怕的噩梦。

segments.en: So I usually wake up in a panic and more tired than before I went to sleep.
segments.cn: 所以我通常会惊慌醒来，比入睡前更累。

segments.en: Wow, maybe you should get that checked out.
segments.cn: 哇，也许你应该去检查一下。

segments.en: Maybe you're stressed?
segments.cn: 也许你很紧张？

segments.en: Just take some sedatives.
segments.cn: 只需服用一些镇静剂。

segments.en: Works for me.
segments.cn: 对我来说有效。

segments.en: Every so often having some Melatonin on hand helps me when I have trouble sleeping.
segments.cn: 有时手边有些褪黑激素可以帮助我解决失眠问题。

segments.en: It works on all kinds of sleeping disorders.
segments.cn: 它对各种睡眠障碍有效。

segments.en: It's the stuff pilots use to regulate their sleeping patterns.
segments.cn: 这是飞行员用来调节睡眠模式的东西。

segments.en: I heard of that.
segments.cn: 我听说过这个。

segments.en: But does that apply to Alex's situation?
segments.cn: 但这适用于亚历克斯的情况吗？

segments.en: Yeah, sure.
segments.cn: 是的，当然。

segments.en: Why not?
segments.cn: 为什么不呢？

segments.en: Sounds like he only has transient insomnia since it's a recent thing.
segments.cn: 听起来他只是暂时性失眠，因为这是最近发生的事。

segments.en: So taking Melatonin should do the trick.
segments.cn: 所以服用褪黑激素应该有效。

segments.en: But shouldn't he be looking into why it's been happening?
segments.cn: 但他不应该调查一下为什么会这样吗？

segments.en: Well, aren't you the little psychologist?
segments.cn: 哦，你真是个小心理学家。

segments.en: Our buddy's having trouble sleeping.
segments.cn: 我们的朋友正在经历失眠。

segments.en: It's easy and curable.
segments.cn: 这很简单且可治愈。

segments.en: It's not something freakish like if he was a sleepwalker.
segments.cn: 这不是像梦游那样的怪事。

segments.en: Well, there's that too.
segments.cn: 嗯，这也是。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So talking about dreaming, nightmares, insomnia, all of this.
segments.cn: 所以谈论梦境、噩梦、失眠，所有这些。

segments.en: What do you do if you can't fall asleep?
segments.cn: 如果你无法入睡，你会怎么做？

segments.en: I don't really have this problem personally because I could fall asleep anywhere, anytime.
segments.cn: 我个人并没有这个问题，因为我可以随时随地入睡。

segments.en: I've heard some people take warm milk before going to sleep.
segments.cn: 我听说有些人在睡觉前喝温牛奶。

segments.en: Yes, some people take milk.
segments.cn: 是的，有些人喝牛奶。

segments.en: Although I also heard that dairy products before bedtime can make you have nightmares.
segments.cn: 虽然我也听说过，睡前吃乳制品可能会让你做噩梦。

segments.en: Like if you eat cheese before bed.
segments.cn: 比如说，如果你在睡前吃奶酪。

segments.en: I've heard that as well.
segments.cn: 我也听说过这个。

segments.en: I've heard that if you have seafood before bed, you'll have nightmares as well.
segments.cn: 我听说如果你睡前吃海鲜，也会做噩梦。

segments.en: But actually, have you ever had a dream when you are doing something and you wake up in the middle of that?
segments.cn: 但实际上，你有没有过在做某件事时做梦，然后在中间醒来的经历？

segments.en: Yes.
segments.cn: 有。

segments.en: I remember once I was dreaming, I was drinking a soda.
segments.cn: 我记得有一次我在做梦，正在喝汽水。

segments.en: And all of a sudden I woke up and I had my hand in the air doing the action of me actually drinking the soda.
segments.cn: 突然我醒来，手举在空中，做着喝汽水的动作。

segments.en: Actually, sometimes this happens to me when I'm falling asleep.
segments.cn: 其实，有时候我在入睡时也会发生这种情况。

segments.en: I imagine I'm on a bike or something and I start to feel myself moving my legs.
segments.cn: 我想象自己在骑自行车，开始感觉到自己在动腿。

segments.en: And I wake up and I'm like, wait, wait, what am I doing?
segments.cn: 然后我醒来，心想，等一下，我在做什么？

segments.en: So the brain is very strained, I think, especially in those times when you're kind of asleep and you're kind of awake.
segments.cn: 所以我觉得大脑在那种半睡半醒的状态下非常紧张。

segments.en: Also when you wake up suddenly, I don't know if other people have experienced this, but you feel like you're falling or something.
segments.cn: 还有，当你突然醒来时，我不知道其他人是否有过这种经历，但你会感觉自己在下落或什么的。

segments.en: All of a sudden you just wake up with a shake.
segments.cn: 突然间你就会猛地醒来。

segments.en: Yeah, your body moves.
segments.cn: 是的，你的身体会动。

segments.en: It's very scary.
segments.cn: 这非常可怕。

segments.en: Your heart starts to beat.
segments.cn: 你的心开始跳动。

segments.en: I don't know why that happens.
segments.cn: 我不知道为什么会这样。

segments.en: It's unusual.
segments.cn: 这很不寻常。

segments.en: Well, we're curious to know what your sleep habits are.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们很好奇你的睡眠习惯。

segments.en: Do you have a hard time sleeping or are you like me?
segments.cn: 你睡觉困难，还是像我一样？

segments.en: It's very easy for you to fall asleep.
segments.cn: 你很容易就能入睡。

segments.en: Let us know at our website, EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 在我们的网站 EnglishPod.com 告诉我们吧。

segments.en: Alright, we'll see you guys there.
segments.cn: 好的，我们在那里见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
